answers.answer: Hi, how old are you? Any history of diabetes  or hypertension? This could be due to autonomic neuropathy, a condition where pooling of blood happens in legs due to inability of vessels to contract.Electrolyte imbalance, hypoglycemia, anemia etc are some of the other reasons. Please get blood tests done. Once blood tests are normal, might think of brain lesions.

I'm 20 years old, no history of diabetes in my family. II had my blood pressure taken at a clinic about a week after I first started getting lightheaded and it was normal then. I haven't had my BP taken since.
I'm not sure if you are male or female.  Could you be pregnant?  I was having the problem and right after I finally crashed to the floor, I found out I was 5 weeks.

Sorry, this was my first post here, so I guess I left a few things out.I'm a 20 year old male college student from New Jersey, in the United States. I have irritable bowel syndrome and chronic prostatitis. I also discovered today that I have had a sinus infection that has gone untreated for some 10 months. I am scheduled to return to an ENT on Wednesday to discuss the infection and, I suppose, to be put on antibiotics.All that being said, is it possible that an untreated sinus infection could be causing my problems?

question: For the last three to four weeks, I have been experiencing either a lightheadedness or a mild dizziness. Originally, it only occurred after being upright for a couple hours but has since become more frequent, sometimes being present even when I am laying down. It has also been accompanied by occasional headaches that seem to move around my head but never lasts long. Any thoughts?
title: Question about recurrent lightheadedness/dizziness?
